p: The specific chemical profile of Hyptis obtusiflora has not yet been studied, although there is information about co-generic species and data on their chemical profiles (see Table 1). The biological applications of some of the components isolated from close species are well known as anti-inflammatories or antinociceptives in several cases. Thus, 1,8-cineole has shown therapeutic benefits in inflammatory diseases, such as asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [ 36]; E-caryophyllene is an antiinflammatory molecule because (a) it produces an anti-spasmodic activity on smooth muscle, which is probably related to Ca 2+ channel blockade [ 37]; and (b) it induces inhibition of cytokines involved in the arachidonic acid and histamine pathways [ 38].
